metadata.title: Trump Nominates Federal Reserve Critic Kevin Warsh to Run US Central Bank

sections.title: Hook/Introduction
sections.content: Good evening, I'm [Your Name], and this is [Channel Name]. In a surprise move, President Donald Trump has nominated Kevin Warsh, a former Federal Reserve governor, to lead the US central bank. But what does this mean for the US economy? Let's dive in.
sections.visual_prompt: A graphic with the title 'Trump Nominates Kevin Warsh' and a photo of Donald Trump and Kevin Warsh

sections.title: Main point 1: Background on Kevin Warsh and his qualifications for the job
sections.content: Kevin Warsh is no stranger to the world of finance. As a former governor of the Federal Reserve, he played a key role in shaping monetary policy during the financial crisis. He's also been a vocal critic of the Fed's actions, which has raised eyebrows among some experts.
sections.visual_prompt: A graphic with Kevin Warsh's photo and a brief overview of his background

sections.title: Main point 2: Reaction from experts and politicians
sections.content: Not everyone is happy about the nomination. Some experts say Warsh's views on monetary policy are too hawkish, while others praise his experience and expertise. Politicians are also weighing in, with some expressing concerns about the potential impact on the economy.
sections.visual_prompt: A split-screen graphic with quotes from experts and politicians

sections.title: Conclusion/Call to action: What this means for the US economy
sections.content: So what does this mean for the US economy? We'll be keeping a close eye on how Warsh's policies play out. In the meantime, if you want to stay up-to-date on the latest economic news and analysis, be sure to subscribe to our channel and hit that notification bell.
sections.visual_prompt: A graphic with the channel's logo and a call-to-action to subscribe

call_to_action: Subscribe and like the video for more economic news and analysis
